com.defano.jmonet.tools.base

Interface MutableSelection

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    TransformableSelection
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSelectionTool, AbstractTransformTool, LassoTool, PerspectiveTool, ProjectionTool, RotateTool, RubberSheetTool, ScaleTool, SelectionTool, SlantTool

    public interface MutableSelection
    Represents an image selection that can be changed programmatically.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void adjustSelectionBounds(int xDelta, int yDelta)
      Invoked to indicate that the selection has moved on the canvas.
      BufferedImage getSelectedImage()
      Gets the image represented by the selection.
      Point getSelectionLocation()
      Determines the location (top-left coordinate) of the selection outline (getSelectionOutline() on the canvas.
      Shape getSelectionOutline()
      Gets the bounding selection shape of the current selection outline, i.e., the path on which "marching ants" will be drawn.
      boolean hasSelection()
      Determines if the user has an active selection.
      void redrawSelection()
      Clears the scratch buffer then draws the selected image and selection outline ("marching ants") onto it.
      void resetSelection()
      Reset the selection boundary to its initial, no-selection state.
      void setDirty()
      Marks the selection as having been mutated (either by transformation or movement).
      void setSelectedImage(BufferedImage image)
      Replaces the current selected image with the given image.
      void setSelectionOutline(Rectangle bounds)
      Specifies the selection rectangle (bounds) of the current selection, i.e., the rectangular path on which "marching ants" will be drawn.

    • Method Detail

      • resetSelection

        void resetSelection()
        Reset the selection boundary to its initial, no-selection state. getSelectionOutline() should return null following a selection reset, but prior to defining a new selection.

      • getSelectionLocation

        Point getSelectionLocation()
        Determines the location (top-left coordinate) of the selection outline (getSelectionOutline() on the canvas.
        Returns:
        Get the top-left coordinate of the selection boundary

      • getSelectionOutline

        Shape getSelectionOutline()
        Gets the bounding selection shape of the current selection outline, i.e., the path on which "marching ants" will be drawn.
        Returns:
        The selection outline

      • setSelectionOutline

        void setSelectionOutline(Rectangle bounds)
        Specifies the selection rectangle (bounds) of the current selection, i.e., the rectangular path on which "marching ants" will be drawn.
        Parameters:
        bounds - The new selection bounds.

      • hasSelection

        boolean hasSelection()
        Determines if the user has an active selection. A selection exists only after the user has completed defining a closed, selection outline.
        Returns:
        True is a selection exists, false otherwise.

      • setDirty

        void setDirty()
        Marks the selection as having been mutated (either by transformation or movement).

      • setSelectedImage

        void setSelectedImage(BufferedImage image)
        Replaces the current selected image with the given image. It is the caller's responsibility to mask the given image to assure it does not exceed the selection bounds.
        Parameters:
        image - The image with which to replace the selection.

      • getSelectedImage

        BufferedImage getSelectedImage()
        Gets the image represented by the selection. Note that a user can select and modify a non-rectangular selection, but the selected image returned by this method will always be a rectangle whose bounds are the smallest rectangle that can fit in the selected shape. Any pixels outside the user's selection shape will be fully transparent pixels in the returned image.
        Returns:
        The selected image

      • adjustSelectionBounds

        void adjustSelectionBounds(int xDelta,
                           int yDelta)
        Invoked to indicate that the selection has moved on the canvas. The selection shape's coordinates should be translated by the given amount.
        Parameters:
        xDelta - Number of pixels to move horizontally.
        yDelta - Number of pixels to move vertically.

      • redrawSelection

        void redrawSelection()
        Clears the scratch buffer then draws the selected image and selection outline ("marching ants") onto it.
